items.title: American Holly
items.content:
Tree type: Evergreen and Ornamental
Mature size: 40-50’ tall
Wildlife: American holly’s foliage provides cover for birds and mammals. Their fruit is a favorite of many songbirds!
Fun Fact: Their flowers attract bees!
Paragraph:

items.title: Loblolly Pine
items.content:
Tree type:
Mature size: 60-90’ tall
Wildlife: Loblolly pines provide a home and food for various animals, especially birds liek wild turkeys. 
Fun Fact:
Paragraph:

items.title: American Beech
items.content:
Tree type: Shade and Ornamental
Mature size: 50-70’ tall
Wildlife: Beech trees produce beechnuts that are a chipmunk and squirrel favorite!
Fun Fact: American Beech retains a smooth bark even as it ages!
Paragraph

items.title: Poison Ivy
items.content:
Disclaimer: DO NOT TOUCH IT!
Paragraph:
Fun Fact: Poison Ivy never has thorns!

items.title: Chinese Privet
items.content:
Paragraph:
Fun fact: The hedges in Sanford Stadium are made of Chinese Privet plants!

items.title: White-tailed Deer
items.content:
Scientific name: Odocoileus virginianus
DIET: Herbivore (plants)
Habitat: Fields, meadows and forests
Paragraph:
Fun Fact: White-tailed deer hide their fawns on the forest floor or in tall grass to keep them safe.

items.title: American Robin
items.content:
Scientific name:Turdus migratorius
DIET: Omnivores (plants and animals)
Habitat: forests, farmland, lawns, cities
Paragraph:
Fun Fact: It is the national bird of Great Britain

items.title: Beaver
items.content:
Scientific name:Castor canadensis
DIET: Herbivores (plants)
Habitat: Streams, lakes, ponds, wetlands, swamps
Paragraph:
Fun Fact:

items.title: Eastern Wild Turkey
items.content:
Scientific Name: Meleagris gallopavo silvestris
DIET: Omnivore (plants and animals)
Habitat: Forests with mature hardwood in fall and winter, open fields in spring and summer
Paragraph:
Fun Fact:
-Track recognition
	    -deer tracks
	    -turkey tracks
